Has run out of corridor.  She looks back at the Knight cl the distance.  CRYING in fear, she frantically searches f a way out. The Knight is nearly upon her. In desperation she runs into a janitorial closet, closing its heavy door.
Is dark and full of old paint cans and mops.  Her BREATHI is at a PANIC.
Tries the door handle. Stepping back, he lifts his sword and HAMMERS it deep int the wood.
(crying) Oh God...
He STRIKES again.  And again.  Splinters smack against su ing walls.
Go away!  Oh God, go away!
CRYING hysterically, Brenna presses herself against the f wall, sliding to the floor in a crouch.
Steps back and gives the door a last two-fisted swing. Brenna SCREAMS. The door collapses.
A group of unmarked police cars race by with the last lig of day.
At the wheel is Moran's assistant, the inspector.

Taupin stands at his fireplace, the only light in the roo poking at it with a tong. His gaze goes to a mantle clock. It is 10:30 PM. The phone RINGS. He looks to it. It RINGS again. He picks up the receiver slowly and places it against his
We have some unfinished business.
Are you here?
I want you to come to me.
And if I refuse?
Give me an address where I can forward Miss Cart- wright's head.
This affects him.
Yes laddie, I have her.
Should I care?
You have three hours.
The unmarked cars shoot by.
Taupin hangs up the phone. He looks to the sword on the table, reflecting the fireli

POLICE OFFICERS, placed around Taupin's house, are COCKIN shotguns and CHAMBERING pistols. Two officers take positions on either side of the door. third, after getting the signal, kicks the door open.
The officers drop to firing positions in the doorway.  Th room is empty.
An officer BURSTS in.  It's empty.
The Inspector is on the phone.
He's not here.
Spotlights seperate the whitemarble from the surrounding blackness. Taupin's face moves into frame.
Sword firmly in one hand, Taupin climb's the monument's s
A twenty-five foot bronze of Thomas Jefferson flanked by quotations. A sword in one hand and Brenna in the other, the Knight s at the statue's base.
Welcome.
Taupin stands at the entrance.
Kahn sends his best.
In a corner the Asian's head lies on its side, the horror death still pressed into the face.  Taupin's eyes return to the Knight and Brenna.
Let her go.
The Knight throws Brenna roughly against a wall.
You disappoint me. (looks at Brenna) I thought you'd finally gotten over that sort of thing.
Leave her out of this.
As you wish.

The Knight holds his sword out at a ceremonial angle.  Ta does the same.  The weapons are CLANKED together twice, t pulled back into battle position. The two begin walking a circle, poised swords waiting for opening. The Knight leaps first, his clash of steel RINGING off th walls. Another ATTACK without result.
You can do better than that.
Taupin swings.  The Knight jumps back.  Sweat gleams from brows.
Two LOVERS enjoy a late night walk along the tidal basin. There is a distant CLANKING of metal.
It's from over near the memorial.
He jumps up on a rock.  Several yards away can be seen tw attacking each other.
Shit.
Standing at a map of the city, Moran nurses a cup of coff The phone RINGS.
Moran.  All right, get a patrol unit out there right away.  I'll meet them.

The Knight and Taupin are PANTING heavily. The Knight goes low.  Taupin blocks.  The Knight comes ov quickly.  Taupin misjudges and the blade slices deep into shoulder and chest.  The impact knocks him flat on his ba The Knight looks down on his wounded prey. A SCREECH of brakes from outside the monument.  Two OFFIC are coming up the steps.
No.  Not now.
The officers reach the top and enter.
One of the officers is Dennis, who sees only a CRYING Bre and Taupin lying wounded on the floor.
Brenna?
The Knight rushes up from behind, his sword in full swing
Moran's car blows through a cross street.
Moran is at the wheel.
The Knight walks from the two officers spread out like ra dolls on the floor.
(to Taupin) Get up.
Taupin looks at Brenna and the dead policemen.  A resigna sweeps over him.
What's the point?
This isn't done.  Get up.
What's the point!  You have me, finish it!
I have waited forever for this. You will not cheapen it, little boy.
(irony) Tradition.
It's all we have.
Go to hell.
The Knight looks to Brenna.
Perhaps Miss Cartwright would like to play.
Leave her alone.
Get up.
Taupin struggles to his feet.  Blood pouring from his shi stands uneasily with his sword at ready. The Knight swings.  Taupin blocks.
Moran drives up.  There is an empty police car, the door ajar.
Taupin is badly outclassed. He feebly fends off an attack, but the Knight returns qui with a savage SLICE that rips open Taupin's stomach and t him again to the floor.
You bastard!
Be silent.
Leave him alone.
You will be silent!!
The voice is THUNDERING. Taupin kneels with his forehead pressed against the floor teeth grind in pain. The Knight smiles.
I do hope you're enjoying this as much as me.
Stands in the entryway.  The Knight sees him.
Get out.
Moran draws his pistol. The Knight walks toward him,
This is nothing that concerns you.
Moran levels his gun. The Knight raises his sword.
You will leave!
